THE BOEING STRATOCRUISER is the first true post-war
super
transport,
incorporating not only greater size and comfort, but also, for the first time,
the great war-time engineering advancements developed and
proved in
the Boeing B-29.
The cutaway above shows many of its unique features
- the roomy
main upper cabins, distinctive lower deck lounge, ample
dressing rooms for both men and women, the galley, from which come
tempting hot meals, and the lower deck forward cargo hold
and aft
luggage compartment accessible in flight.
Carrying from 55 to 114 passengers,
cruising high above
surface
storms at well over 300 miles per hour, with a range of more than 4,500
miles, the Stratocruiser offers unprecedented
standards of performance,
operating efficiency and reliability.
You would expect such an airplane from Boeing, world's leading
builder of four-engine aircraft, pioneer in altitude-conditioning of planes
for over-weather flight and creator of such outstanding aircraft as the
ocean-spanning Boeing 314 Flying Boat, Stratoliner, B-17 Flying Fortress
and B-29 Superfortress.

THE BEING STRATOCRUISER is the first true post-war super transport,
incorporating not only greater size and comfort, but also, for the first time,
the great war-time engineering advancements developed and proved in
the Boeing B-29. The cutaway above shows many of its unique features
- the roomy main upper cabins, distinctive lower deck lounge, ample
dressing rooms for both men and women, the galley, from which come
tempting hot meals, and the lower deck forward cargo hold and aft
luggage compartment accessible. in flight.
Carrying from 55 to 114 passengers, cruising high above surface
storms at well over 300 miles per hour, with a range of more than 4,500
miles, the Stratocruiser offers unprecedented standards of performance,
operating efficiency and reliability.
You would expect such an airplane from Boeing, world's leading
builder of four-engine aircraft, pioneer in altitude-conditioning of planes
for over-weather flight and creator of such outstanding aircraft as the
ocean-spanning Boeing 314 Flying Boat, Stratoliner, B-17 Flying Fortress
and B-29 Superfortress.

THE STRATOCRUISER is the first transport with
two passenger decks.
An airplane with
in which to move about freely, and a lower-
deck lounge for your enjoyment.
space and comtort are designed into this
first true super-transport. The main cabin 15
10½ feet wide - considerably wider than
railroad car - has an aisle height of seven feet.
Seats are roomy, with plenty of leg room for
stretching out. Berths are 7 inches wider, two

Whether you're an experienced air traveler
